020package com.bewsoftware.utils.string;
021
022import java.util.Objects;
023
024/**
025 * This class contains some helper methods.
026 *
027 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
028 *
029 * @since 1.0.6
030 * @version 2.0.1
031 */
032public class Strings
033{
034    /**
035     * This class is not meant to be instantiated.
036     */
037    private Strings()
038    {
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * centre fills the {@code number} within a text string of {@code width}
043     * length.
044     *
045     * @param number to wrap
046     * @param width  of required text
047     *
048     * @return the formatted text
049     */
050    public static String centreFill(final int number, final int width)
051    {
052        return centreFill(Integer.toString(number), width);
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Formats the {@code text} to be centred within a text string of
057     * {@code width}
058     * length.
059     *
060     * @param text  to wrap
061     * @param width of required text
062     *
063     * @return the formatted text
064     */
065    public static String centreFill(final String text, final int width)
066    {
067        String rtn;
068        int length = text.length();
069
070        // Process only if necessary
071        if (length < width)
072        {
073            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
074            int preLen = (width - text.length()) / 2;
075            int postLen = width - text.length() - preLen;
076            sb.append(" ".repeat(preLen)).append(text).append(" ".repeat(postLen));
077            rtn = sb.toString();
078
079        } else
080        {
081            rtn = text;
082        }
083
084        return rtn;
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Fills out a new String with the <i>text</i> repeated <i>count</i> times.
089     *
090     * @implNote
091     * Uses {@code text.repeat(count)} to fill out String.
092     *
093     * @param text  to repeat
094     * @param count number of repeats
095     *
096     * @return new String
097     *
098     * @see java.lang.String#repeat(int)
099     */
100    public static String fill(final String text, final int count)
101    {
102        return text.repeat(count);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Trim all whitespace characters from the beginning of the text string.
107     *
108     * @param text to trim
109     *
110     * @return new String if trimmed, original String if no trimming needed,
111     *         or {@code null} if 'text' is {@code null}..
112     *
113     * @see Character#isWhitespace(char)
114     */
115    public static String lTrim(final String text)
116    {
117        String rtn = "";
118
119        if (text == null)
120        {
121            rtn = null;
122        } else if (!text.isBlank())
123        {
124            int index = 0;
125
126            while (Character.isWhitespace(text.charAt(index)))
127            {
128                index++;
129            }
130
131            rtn = text.substring(index);
132        }
133
134        return rtn;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Formats the {@code number} to be left justified within a text string of
139     * {@code width} length.
140     * <p>
141     * Appends spaces to the right of the 'number' so the final String is
142     * 'width'
143     * long.
144     *
145     * @param number to wrap
146     * @param width  of required text
147     *
148     * @return the formatted text
149     */
150    public static String leftJustify(final int number, final int width)
151    {
152        return Strings.leftJustify(Integer.toString(number), width);
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Formats the {@code text} to be left justified within a text string of
157     * {@code width} length.
158     * <p>
159     * Appends spaces to the right of the 'text' so the final String is 'width'
160     * long.
161     *
162     * @param text  to wrap
163     * @param width of required text
164     *
165     * @return the formatted text
166     */
167    public static String leftJustify(final String text, final int width)
168    {
169        String rtn = text.trim();
170        int length = rtn.length();
171
172        if (length < width)
173        {
174            rtn += " ".repeat(width - length);
175        }
176
177        return rtn;
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Trim all whitespace characters from the end of the text string.
182     *
183     * @param text to trim
184     *
185     * @return new String if trimmed, original String if no trimming needed,
186     *         or {@code null} if 'text' is {@code null}..
187     *
188     * @see Character#isWhitespace(char)
189     */
190    public static String rTrim(final String text)
191    {
192        String rtn = "";
193
194        if (text == null)
195        {
196            rtn = null;
197        } else if (!text.isBlank())
198        {
199            int index = text.length() - 1;
200
201            while (Character.isWhitespace(text.charAt(index)))
202            {
203                index--;
204            }
205
206            rtn = text.substring(0, index + 1);
207        }
208
209        return rtn;
210    }
211
212    /**
213     * Checks that the specified string isn't <i>blank</i>.
214     * <dl>
215     * <dt>blank:</dt>
216     * <dd>The string is either <i>empty</i> or contains only white space
217     * code-points.</dd>
218     * <dt>empty:</dt>
219     * <dd>The string's {@code length} is {@code 0}.</dd>
220     * </dl>
221     *
222     * @param str The string to check for blankness.
223     *
224     * @return {@code str} if not <i>blank</i>.
225     *
226     * @throws NullPointerException     if {@code str} is <i>null</i>.
227     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code str} is <i>blank</i>.
228     *
229     * @see #requireNonEmpty(java.lang.String)
230     */
231    public static String requireNonBlank(String str)
232    {
233        if (Objects.requireNonNull(str).isBlank())
234        {
235            throw new IllegalArgumentException("isBlank.");
236        }
237
238        return str;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Checks that the specified string isn't <i>blank</i>.
243     * <dl>
244     * <dt>blank:</dt>
245     * <dd>The string is either <i>empty</i> or contains only white space
246     * code-points.</dd>
247     * <dt>empty:</dt>
248     * <dd>The string's {@code length} is {@code 0}.</dd>
249     * </dl>
250     *
251     * @param str     The string to check for blankness.
252     * @param message Detail message to be used in the event that an exception
253     *                is thrown.
254     *
255     * @return {@code str} if not <i>blank</i>.
256     *
257     * @throws NullPointerException     if {@code str} is <i>null</i>.
258     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code str} is <i>blank</i>.
259     *
260     * @see #requireNonEmpty(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
261     */
262    public static String requireNonBlank(String str, String message)
263    {
264        if (Objects.requireNonNull(str, message).isBlank())
265        {
266            throw new IllegalArgumentException("isBlank: " + message);
267        }
268
269        return str;
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Checks that the specified string isn't <i>empty</i>.
274     * <dl>
275     * <dt>empty:</dt>
276     * <dd>The string's {@code length} is {@code 0}.</dd>
277     * </dl>
278     *
279     * @param str The string to check for emptiness.
280     *
281     * @return {@code str} if not <i>empty</i>.
282     *
283     * @throws NullPointerException     if {@code str} is <i>null</i>.
284     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code str} is <i>empty</i>.
285     */
286    public static String requireNonEmpty(String str)
287    {
288        if (Objects.requireNonNull(str).isEmpty())
289        {
290            throw new IllegalArgumentException("isEmpty.");
291        }
292
293        return str;
294    }
295
296    /**
297     * Checks that the specified string isn't <i>empty</i>.
298     * <dl>
299     * <dt>empty:</dt>
300     * <dd>The string's {@code length} is {@code 0}.</dd>
301     * </dl>
302     *
303     * @param str     The string to check for emptiness.
304     * @param message Detail message to be used in the event that an exception
305     *                is thrown.
306     *
307     * @return {@code str} if not <i>empty</i>.
308     *
309     * @throws NullPointerException     if {@code str} is <i>null</i>.
310     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code str} is <i>empty</i>.
311     */
312    public static String requireNonEmpty(String str, String message)
313    {
314        if (Objects.requireNonNull(str, message).isEmpty())
315        {
316            throw new IllegalArgumentException("isEmpty: " + message);
317        }
318
319        return str;
320    }
321
322}
